| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                       | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1882](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1882 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **wombat**, z, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic"), [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [zouthern animal](/wiki/Zouthern_animal "Zouthern animal").

A wombat possesses a kick and a bite attack.

## Generation

Wombats will not randomly generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

## Strategy

The wombat is a rather unremarkable monster, doing middling damage and moving at the same speed as an unhasted player. Though it is roughly comparable to a [wolf](/wiki/Wolf "Wolf"), encounters with them tend to be easier since wombats do not generate in groups. Their [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of 5 is the best among the zouthern animals, but still very mediocre, and they have no resistances or [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") to speak of.

While wombats can be tamed with [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") food similar to [horses](/wiki/Horse "Horse"), their inferior combat abilities and diet make this less than worthwhile.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Wombat](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wombat "wikipedia:Wombat")***

Wombats are short-legged, muscular quadrupedal marsupials that are native to Australia. A wombat is about 1 meter (40 in) in length with a small, stubby tail, and weighs between 20 and 35 kg (44 and 77 lb). Wombats are adaptable and habitat tolerant, and are found in forested, mountainous, and heathland areas of southern and eastern Australia - this includes Tasmania and an isolated patch of more than 700 acres in Epping Forest National Park within central Queensland.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Wombat

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
z wombat
Difficulty 6
Attacks Kick 1d6, Bite 1d2
z wombat
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Kick 1d6, Bite 1d2

Base level 5
Base experience 56
Speed 12
Base AC 5
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 40
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A wombat:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is herbivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1882

A wombat, z, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SpliceHack, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. It is a domestic, herbivorous zouthern animal.

A wombat possesses a kick and a bite attack.

Generation

Wombats will not randomly generate in Gehennom.

Strategy

The wombat is a rather unremarkable monster, doing middling damage and moving at the same speed as an unhasted player. Though it is roughly comparable to a wolf, encounters with them tend to be easier since wombats do not generate in groups. Their AC of 5 is the best among the zouthern animals, but still very mediocre, and they have no resistances or MR score to speak of.

While wombats can be tamed with vegan food similar to horses, their inferior combat abilities and diet make this less than worthwhile.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Wombat

Wombats are short-legged, muscular quadrupedal marsupials that are native to Australia. A wombat is about 1 meter (40 in) in length with a small, stubby tail, and weighs between 20 and 35 kg (44 and 77 lb). Wombats are adaptable and habitat tolerant, and are found in forested, mountainous, and heathland areas of southern and eastern Australia - this includes Tasmania and an isolated patch of more than 700 acres in Epping Forest National Park within central Queensland.

A '''wombat''', {{monsym|wombat}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SpliceHack]], [[SlashTHEM]], and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[domestic]], [[herbivorous]] [[zouthern animal]].

A wombat possesses a kick and a bite attack.

==Generation==
Wombats will not randomly generate in [[Gehennom]].

==Strategy==
The wombat is a rather unremarkable monster, doing middling damage and moving at the same speed as an unhasted player. Though it is roughly comparable to a [[wolf]], encounters with them tend to be easier since wombats do not generate in groups. Their [[AC]] of 5 is the best among the zouthern animals, but still very mediocre, and they have no resistances or [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] to speak of.

While wombats can be tamed with [[vegan]] food similar to [[horse]]s, their inferior combat abilities and diet make this less than worthwhile.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Wombat}}
Wombats are short-legged, muscular quadrupedal marsupials that are native to Australia. A wombat is about 1 meter (40 in) in length with a small, stubby tail, and weighs between 20 and 35 kg (44 and 77 lb). Wombats are adaptable and habitat tolerant, and are found in forested, mountainous, and heathland areas of southern and eastern Australia - this includes Tasmania and an isolated patch of more than 700 acres in Epping Forest National Park within central Queensland.
